In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the solution:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(s, " ")
    result = ""
    for word in words
        if length(result) + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
        elseif !isempty(result)
            result *= " "
        end
        result *= word
    end
    return result
end
```

You can test this function with the following example:

```julia
s = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua."
println(wrap_string(s))
```

This will print:

```julia
Lorem ipsum
dolor sit amet,
consectetur 
adipiscing elit.
Sed do eiusmod 
tempor incididunt 
ut labore et 
dolore magna 
aliqua.
```
